snippet: Quarterly earnings were more than $190 million, compared with a loss in the year-ago period, a bright sign for the country’s banking system.
abstract: Unicredit announces that in last quarter of 2014 it returned to profit, reporting quarterly profit of 170 million euros, or around $192 million, compared with loss of 15 billion euros in year-ago period; bank is Italy's largest, but country's third largest bank Monte dei Paschi di Siena reports loss of 4.2 billion euros, indication that country's banking system is still recovering.
lead_paragraph: Quarterly earnings were more than $190 million, compared with a loss in the year-ago period, a bright sign for the country’s banking system.

headline.main: UniCredit of Italy Reports Profit Amid Cost-Cutting
headline.print_headline: UniCredit Bank of Italy Reports a Return to Profit

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Monte dei Paschi di Siena SpA
